title: Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory Announce Fall 2025 Tour
description: Van Etten and her band will perform across North America with support from Torres
author: Walden Green
excerpt: Van Etten and her band will perform across North America with support from Torres
text: Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory have announced their second North American tour of the year. Following a run of European shows this summer, the band will hit the road stateside on September 11 in Indianapolis, Indiana. They’ll be supported by Torres at almost all U.S. and Canadian stops. Check out a complete list of Van Etten & co.’s 2025 shows below.Van Etten shared Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory in February, marking the singer’s seventh studio album and first credited jointly with her touring band. They recently performed the album track “Somethin’ Ain’t Right” on Jimmy Kimmel Live! Last year, Van Etten reissued her 2014 LP Are We There for its 10th anniversary.Read more about Sharon Van Etten in “The 200 Most Important Artists of Pitchfork’s First 25 Years.”All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory: Fall Tour 2025Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory:08-13-16 Paredes de Coura, Portugal - Vodafone Paredes de Coura08-19 Cork, Ireland - Cork Opera House08-20 Belfast, Northern Ireland - Mandela Hall08-21 Dublin, Ireland - National Museum of Ireland, Collins Barracks08-23 Utrecht, Netherlands - TivoliVrenburg08-24 Paris, France - Rock en Seine08-25 Liege, Belgium - OM08-27 Cardiff, Wales - Depot08-28-31 Dorset, England - End of the Road Festival08-29 Leeds, England - O2 Academy Leeds08-30 Newcastle, England - Boiler Shop09-18 Indianapolis, IN - Hi-Fi Annex *09-19 Columbus, OH - Newport Music Hall *09-20 Camden, NJ - Xponential Music Festival09-22 Montreal, Quebec - Le National *09-23 Portsmouth, NH - Music Hall *09-25 Charlottesville, VA - Jefferson Theatre *09-26 Washington, D.C. - All Things Go Festival09-27 Jersey City, NJ - White Eagle Hall *09-29 Carrboro, NC - Cat’s Cradle *09-30 Charlotte, NC - Neighborhood Theatre *10-01 Charleston, SC - Charleston Music Hall* with Torres
html:
Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory have announced their second North American tour of the year. Following a run of European shows this summer, the band will hit the road stateside on September 11 in Indianapolis, Indiana. They’ll be supported by Torres at almost all U.S. and Canadian stops. Check out a complete list of Van Etten & co.’s 2025 shows below.

Van Etten shared Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory in February, marking the singer’s seventh studio album and first credited jointly with her touring band. They recently performed the album track “Somethin’ Ain’t Right” on Jimmy Kimmel Live! Last year, Van Etten reissued her 2014 LP Are We There for its 10th anniversary.

Read more about Sharon Van Etten in “The 200 Most Important Artists of Pitchfork’s First 25 Years.”

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory: Fall Tour 2025

Sharon Van Etten & the Attachment Theory:

08-13-16 Paredes de Coura, Portugal - Vodafone Paredes de Coura
08-19 Cork, Ireland - Cork Opera House
08-20 Belfast, Northern Ireland - Mandela Hall
08-21 Dublin, Ireland - National Museum of Ireland, Collins Barracks
08-23 Utrecht, Netherlands - TivoliVrenburg
08-24 Paris, France - Rock en Seine
08-25 Liege, Belgium - OM
08-27 Cardiff, Wales - Depot
08-28-31 Dorset, England - End of the Road Festival
08-29 Leeds, England - O2 Academy Leeds
08-30 Newcastle, England - Boiler Shop
09-18 Indianapolis, IN - Hi-Fi Annex *

09-25 Charlottesville, VA - Jefferson Theatre *
09-26 Washington, D.C. - All Things Go Festival
09-27 Jersey City, NJ - White Eagle Hall *
09-29 Carrboro, NC - Cat’s Cradle *
09-30 Charlotte, NC - Neighborhood Theatre *
10-01 Charleston, SC - Charleston Music Hall

* with Torres
